author: @rg305 Rudy Gomez
title: Help I'm close to killing myselfðŸ¤¬
text:
Please fill out the fields below so we can help you better. Note: you must provide your domain name to get help. Domain names for issued certificates are all made public in Certificate Transparency logs (e.g. crt.sh | example.com), so withholding your domain name here does not increase secrecy, but only makes it harder for us to provide help.
My domain is:minatepret.com
I ran this command: sudo certbot certonly --dns-cloudflare --dns-cloudflare-credentials=C:/Users/ahmet/OneDrive/Belgeler/CERT/credentials.ini --dns-google-propagation-seconds 120 --email --agree-tos --non-interactive --expand --domains minatepret.com,www.minatepret.com
It produced this output: Ä± dont remember but not working
My web server is (include version):Apache2.4
The operating system my web server runs on is (include version):Windows11
My hosting provider, if applicable, is: Self host
I can login to a root shell on my machine (yes or no, or I don't know): yes
I'm using a control panel to manage my site (no, or provide the name and version of the control panel): no
The version of my client is (e.g. output of certbot --version or certbot-auto --version if you're using Certbot):certbot 1.21.0
certbot --version
certbot-auto --version
And command give a ai. I am really new this place so I don't know. I'm trying to solve it with ai.
Something doesn't seem right.
Yeah, leader, I'm so confused because of that stupid ai.
Also, why do you need a globally signed cert for FQDNs that resolve to RFC-1918 IPs and NXD:
Name: minatepret.com
Address: 192.168.1.194
www.minatepret.com: Non-existent domain
It might be simpler to create your own self-signed cert and just trust that [locally].
it's like a hobby for some fun purposes just to see the https, but other than that I'm unfamiliar with many terms
Sounds like you are in the testing phase.
Please use the test/staging environment for all testing.
You shouldn't be using certbot.
On Windows you should use certify the web, win-acme, posh-acme, or some other Windows specific client.
okey Ä± try
Try:
[very simple to use]
Until you have HTTP access to your system, you will have to use DNS authentication.
FYI, there is no google seen in that part [only cloudflare]:
minatepret.com nameserver = magali.ns.cloudflare.com
minatepret.com nameserver = kianchau.ns.cloudflare.com
yes i use cloudflare
Are you going to use Cloudflare CDN?
[to access your site(s) over the Internet]
yes i use
Then I would recommend that you use their certs.
Is it made directly from the dash
